subSections.title: Glyph origin
Etymology
subSections.text:
; “rank; class; kind; to equate; and the like; ''plural particle''”
: Endoactive of {{och-l|登|to rise; to ascend}} ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
; “to wait”
: A medieval word, probably related to {{och-l|待|to wait}} ({{zh-ref|Wang, 1982}}).

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=děng
|m-s=den3
|c=dang2
|c-t=ang2
|g=den3
|h=pfs=tén/s:tên/s:nên/s:nén/s:nún/s:lún;gd=dên3
|h_note=Southern Sixian: tên/nên - plural particle; tén/nén/nún/lún - progressive particle; tén - other senses
|j=deng2
|mb=dǎing
|md=dēng/dīng
|md_note=dēng - vernacular, used for "rank/grade"; dīng - literary, used for "to wait" or in literary reading
|mn=tán/xm,zz,tw:téng/qz:tńg
|mn_note=tán - vernacular ("to wait"); téng/tńg - literary (“rank/grade”, “and so on”)
|mn-t=dang2/dêng2
|mn-t_note=dang2 - vernacular; dêng2 - literary
|w=2ten
|x=den3
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=v,n,a,part,pn
}}
